Article Title: 'UN unable to respond to global challenges such as terrorism, pandemics': India at UNSC open debate
Article Text: NEW DELHI: India at the UNSC meeting on Wednesday pointed out the UN's shortcomings in addressing complex global issues such as terrorism , pandemics , climate change, threats from emerging technologies, cyberattacks, and the disruptive influence of non-state actors."While we may have succeeded in preventing another world war, this does not hide the reality of the UN's inability to respond to increasingly complex global challenges such as terrorism, pandemics, climate change, threats posed by emerging technologies, cyberattacks and the disruptive role of non-state actors," R.said R. Ravindra, Chargé d'Affaires & DPR of India.India reiterated its call for time-bound negotiations to reform the UNSC, criticising the manipulation of council mechanisms by major powers as detrimental to the multilateral spirit. The ambassdor highlighted the importance of adapting the UNSC to contemporary realities, noting that the current global multipolarity is here to stay."The primary reason the multilateral system has failed to deliver is that it is still stuck in a 1945 vintage binary outlook reflected clearly in the composition of this Security Council. The core of India's position on reformed multilateralism, therefore, lies in a call for the reform of the UN Security Council that is reflective of contemporary realities of today," the ambassdor said.Ambassador R. Ravindra urged for a renewed commitment to timely discussions on reforming the United Nations Security Council (UNSC), emphasizing the importance of adhering to a set timeline for these negotiations while criticizing the actions of certain powerful nations or groups that undermine the process."Let us recommit to time-bound negotiations on UNSC reforms... Sabotaging of negotiating processes and mechanisms by big countries or groups in the narrow interest of their own positions is detrimental to the multilateral spirit and must be called out wherever necessary," he said.The Indian Ambassador addressed the UNSC during an Open Debate on "Multilateral cooperation in the interest of a more just, democratic and sustainable world order."
Article Summary: India at the UNSC meeting on Wednesday pointed out the UN's shortcomings in addressing complex global issues. Criticised manipulation of council mechanisms by major powers as detrimental to the multilateral spirit. Urged for a renewed commitment to timely discussions on reforming the UN Security Council.

Article Title: Reference to IPC, CrPC, and Evidence Act to be read as reference to BNS, BNSS, BSA: Centre
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Centre has invoked Section 8 of the General Clauses Act , 1897 to provide for any references to the erstwhile Indian Penal Code (IPC), Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC) and the Indian Evidence Act in other Acts enacted by Parliament or state legislatures, ordinances and Presidential orders, as references to the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS), Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (BNSS) and Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam (BSA) respectively.“In pursuance of Section 8 of the General Clauses Act 1897, the Centre hereby notifies that where any reference of the Indian Penal Code, 1860, or the Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 or the Indian Evidence Act, 1872 is made in any Act made by Parliament; Act made by legislature of any state; ordinance; regulations made under Article 240 of the Constitution; President’s order; rules, regulations, order or notification made under any Act, ordinance or regulation, in the time being in force; such reference shall respectively be read as the reference of Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita 2023, Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita 2023 or the Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam 2023 and the corresponding provisions of such law shall be construed accordingly,” said a notification issued by the ministry of law and justice on Tuesday.Section 8 of the General Clauses Act of 1897 deals with the construction of references to repealed enactments. It states that if the Act, or any Central Act or regulation made after the commencement of the Act, repeals and re-enacts a provision of a former enactment, then references in any other enactment or instrument to the repealed provision should be construed as references to the re-enacted provision. This is unless a different intention appears.BNS, BNSS and BSA — which replace the IPC, CrPC and Indian Evidence Act respectively — were enacted in December last year and came into force on July 1, 2024.
Article Summary: The Centre has invoked Section 8 of the General Clauses Act, 1897. It provides for references to the erstwhile Indian Penal Code (IPC), Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC) and the Indian Evidence Act in other Acts enacted by Parliament or state legislatures.

Article Title: 'His soul can now rest in peace': Widow after report clears loco pilot of Kanchanjunga Express accident blame
Article Text: KOLKATA/SILIGURI: The bereaved family of goods train loco pilot Anil Kumar has been vindicated as a chief commissioner of railway safety (CCRS) report has cleared him of the blame for the June 17 Kanchanjunga Express accident , which claimed 10 lives and left 43 injured."My husband was blamed for the accident within hours of the train collision. Still mourning his death, we were shocked to hear Anil being held responsible even before the inquiry had begun.But we are glad that Railways has conducted a proper inquiry and cleared him. His soul can now rest in peace," Anil's widow, Roshni Kumar, told TOI .Within two hours of the goods train rear-ending the Kanchanjunga Express, Railway Board chairperson Jaya Verma Sinha and other railway officials jumped to the conclusion that the "deceased pilot" and his injured assistant were at fault.The CCRS preliminary report held that the freight train loco pilot was allowed on a section despite the presence of Kanchanjunga Express and was handed a wrong memo to pass all defective signals without any caution order.The investigation found that the goods train was travelling at 78 kmph when it spotted the rear end of Kanchenjungha Express and applied the emergency brake. But the train could slow down to only 40 kmph before it crashing into Kanchenjungha. The report noted that Anil had adjusted the throttle 10 times in 5 minutes, indicating his alertnesss.Neighbours said they always believed that Kumar couldn't have been at fault, given his stainless career and reputation for sincerity. "It was unfair to blame a dead man for the accident, especially since he was unable to defend himself. We are relieved that that the truth has come out," said Kajal Das, a neighbour.Railway officials said Kumar's family was paid a compensation of Rs 25 lakh. "The pension order has also been issued and the gratuity will be paid soon. Since his sons are still minors, one of them will be offered a job with Railways upon reaching adulthood," said a senior NFR official.
Article Summary: Kanchanjunga Express accident claimed 10 lives and left 43 injured. Chief commissioner of railway safety (CCRS) report has cleared him of the blame. Kumar's family was paid a compensation of Rs 25 lakh. Since his sons are still minors, one of them will be offered a job with Railways.

Article Title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy lists out big-ticket projects to transform old RR district
Article Text:
Revanth Reddy

HYDERABAD: Chief minister A Revanth Reddy on Sunday unveiled his vision to develop the erstwhile Rangareddy (RR) district with a slew of ambitious projects to transform the landscape.Among the plans on the anvil are developing scenic Rachakonda as a hub for the film industry, a new city of international standards in Maheshwaram, and sports universities, medical and health hub, and electric vehicle manufacturing unit in the land earlier acquired for pharma city in the area.The erstwhile Rangareddy district once extended up to Medak in north, Mahabubnagar in south, Nalgonda in east, and bordered Karnataka's Gulbarga in west and Bidar in north west. However, in the districts reorganisation by the previous BRS govt, Rangareddy was split into three districts of Vikarabad, Medchal-Malkajgiri and Rangareddy.The CM, who was speaking at the launch of safety kits for toddy tappers in the district, advised them to encourage their children to go for higher studies to become lawmakers, IAS and IPS officers , and help in the development of Telangana."You should educate your children. Education is the only weapon for weaker sections to become rulers. The state govt will extend full support to toddy tappers and the Goud community in their traditional occupations, but educating children is more important," the CM said.Elaborating on his plans, the CM said that metro rail will be extended up to Hayathnagar and other parts in the district."The state govt will take the responsibility of building a magnificent city at Maheshwaram to compete with New York. The beautiful Rachakonda area, which is similar to Ooty, will also be developed to cater to the film industry. Rangareddy district will witness huge development. The Congress govt is planning to promote the district as a wonderful tourist destination," he said.Officials said the CM plans to expand Greater Hyderabad geographical limits from present 650 sq km to 2,000 sq km up to the ORR, as 'Urban Telangana', and from ORR to Regional Ring Road (RRR) as 'semi-urban Telangana', and RRR to border of the state as 'rural Telangana' . The CM was planning projects keeping in view the proposed delimitation of constituencies in 2026.
Article Summary: The erstwhile Rangareddy district once extended up to Medak in north, Mahabubnagar in south, Nalgonda in east. The beautiful Rachakonda area, which is similar to Ooty, will also be developed to cater to the film industry. The CM was speaking at the launch of safety kits for toddy tappers.

Article Title: Puja Khedkar's IAS training put on hold: How the controversy unfolded
Article Text:
Audi with red beacon



OBC quota controversy

Disability claims under cloud

Curious case of different names

MBBS seat in nomadic tribe-3 quota

Puja Khedkar's parents on run

NEW DELHI: An official car with VIP number plate , quarter and a seperate cabin with adequate staff — It all started when Puja Khedkar , a trainee IAS officer , sought special treatment from the collector's office that are not allowed for a probation officer. What started as a regular transfer case after complaints of alleged misuse of power , led to several questions regarding her disability certificate, selection criteria, etc.In a big step, the government on Tuesday put Khedkar's training in Maharashtra on hold and asked her to report back to the Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration by July 23.Here's how the controversy around trainee IAS officer Puja Khedkar unfolded over the past few days.Pooja Khedkar came to the limelight after she was transferred by the Maharashtra government from Pune to Washim following complaints of alleged misuse of power.Amid this, she also used her private Audi car with a red-blue beacon light and VIP number plate. A 'Maharashtra government' board was also installed on her private car. The video, which went viral on social media, captured Khedkar arriving at the Pune Zilla Parishad office in the luxury vehicle with the beacon light flashing.As the viral went viral, the 2023 batch probationary officer was transferred from Pune collector's office to Washim.Officials said she was shifted based on the collector's report that said Khedkar "sought special privileges, which were not allowed to an IAS probationary officer".Troubles mounted for Khedkar after Maharashtra OBC welfare minister Atul Save announced a suo motu investigation to scrutinise the claims of Puja Khedkar that she belonged to the OBC non-creamy layer.Khedkar had declared herself as belonging to the OBC non-creamy layer to appear in the UPSC examinations.Save told TOI, "The social justice department will take cognisance of the matter and conduct a thorough inquiry to ascertain how she obtained the non-creamy layer certificate."The decision comes in the light of the details of her father Dilip Khedkar's recent Lok Sabha poll affidavit filed as a candidate from Ahmednagar seat which showed assets worth Rs 40 crore. The annual family income threshold for seeking reservation under the OBC non-creamy layer category is set at Rs 8 lakh.Khedkar allegedly submitted fake disability and Other Backward Class (OBC) certificates to clear the civil services exam. Reports indicated that she also submitted a mental illness certificate.In April 2022, she was asked to report to Delhi's All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) for verification of her disability certificate but did not comply, citing a Covid-19 infection.Khedkar is said to have recurrently failed to appear for mandatory medical tests to confirm her disability, despite having qualified for IAS in the 'Persons with Benchmark Disabilities (PwBD)' category.Puja Khedkar, who by now was in the eye of the storm for alleged misuse of power and manipulating disability and OBC quotas, found herself in deeper trouble as discrepancy was found on her part wherein she allegedly used two different names - Khedkar Puja Deeliprao and Puja Manorama Dilip Khedkar during civil services exams.In 2019, in her civil services prelims exam, the IAS trainee had registered herself as Khedkar Puja Deeliprao, and her appointment in SAI was also in the same name with Persons with Benchmark Disabilities (PwBD) (LV) - OBC.However, in her 2022 service allocation by Union Public Services Commission (UPSC), where she was selected for IAS, she went by the name Puja Manorama Dilip Khedkar under the PwBD-multiple disabilities (MD) category.In a Central Administrative Tribunal, Mumbai bench, order dated Feb 23, 2023, her name as the applicant was mentioned as Puja Manorama Dilip Khedkar.Probationary IAS officer Puja Khedkar had in August 2022 simultaneously applied for disability certificates for locomotor disability from District Civil Hospital, Aundh, and Yashwantrao Chavan Memorial Hospital, Pimpri, both in Pune, report Nisha Nambiar & Swati Shinde Gole.Embroiled in a controversy over the legitimacy of her certificates, Khedkar was alleged to have secured MBBS admission to Pune’s Shrimati Kashibai Navale Medical College and General Hospital in 2007 under the reserved nomadic tribe-3 category furnishing a non-creamy layer OBC certificate.Khedkar gained admission through the Association of Management of Unaided Private Medical and Dental Colleges of Maharashtra (AMUPMDC) entrance test, scoring 146 out of 200, said college director Arvind Bhore said Saturday. AMUPMDC no longer exists after NEET’s introduction.Amid heightened media scrutiny of Puja Khedkar, her parents are on the run following the filing of an FIR against them for allegedly threatening a farmer.Separate teams of Pune police visited the Baner bungalow of Puja’s mother, Manorama Khedkar, on Sunday, but received no response despite repeated attempts to make contact.The case was filed on Friday night after a video surfaced showing Manorama Khedkar, accompanied by private bouncers, brandishing a pistol on June 5, last year, during an argument with farmers over a land ownership dispute.On Saturday, police recorded statements from witnesses in Dhadawali and conducted a spot panchnama.At 7 am on Sunday, officials from the Paud police and the Rural police’s local crime branch arrived at Manorama’s bungalow.
Article Summary: Pooja Khedkar came to the limelight after she was transferred by the Maharashtra government from Pune to Washim following complaints of alleged misuse of power. She also used her private Audi car with a red-blue beacon light and VIP number plate. A 'Mahar Maharashtra government' board was also installed on her private car.

Article Title: Puja Khedkar's IAS training put on hold amid fake certificate row
Article Text:
Curious case of two names

NEW DELHI: The government on Tuesday put Puja Khedkar 's IAS training on hold amid a fake certificate probe and directed her to return to the academy in Mussoorie at the earliest.Khedkar has also been relieved from the District Training Programme of the Maharashtra government."LBSNAA, Mussoorie has decided to keep your District Training Program on hold and immediately recall you for further necessary action...," the letter from Nitin Gadre, additional chief secretary (P) read.Puja Khedkar has been in the eye of the storm for alleged misuse of power and manipulating disability and OBC quotas.Khedkar allegedly submitted fake disability and Other Backward Class (OBC) certificates to clear the civil services exam. Reports indicate she also submitted a mental illness certificate.In April 2022, she was asked to report to Delhi's All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) for verification of her disability certificate but did not comply, citing a Covid-19 infection.Khedkar is said to have recurrently failed to appear for mandatory medical tests to confirm her disability, despite having qualified for IAS in the 'Persons with Benchmark Disabilities (PwBD)' category.The action comes after the central government established a single-member committee to examine the claims and details surrounding Khedkar's candidature.The ministry of personnel on July 13 had announced that the committee, chaired by a senior officer of the rank of Additional Secretary, would submit its report in two weeks.Sources in the government told TOI that the panel of DoPT additional secretary Manoj Dwivedi will, over the next two weeks, probe how she obtained the documents establishing her disability and OBC status, and whether proper vetting was carried out by the issuing authority.The panel will, in consultation with experts from AIIMS Delhi, also examine if the visual and mental disability claimed by her meets the benchmarks for employment in the government.Puja Khedkar is also reportedly involved in another discrepancy where in she used two different names - Khedkar Puja Deeliprao and Puja Manorama Dilip Khedkar.In 2019, in her civil services prelims exam, the IAS trainee had registered herself as Khedkar Puja Deeliprao, and her appointment in SAI was also in the same name with Persons with Benchmark Disabilities (PwBD) (LV) - OBC.However, in her 2022 service allocation by Union Public Services Commission (UPSC), where she was selected for IAS, she went by the name Puja Manorama Dilip Khedkar under the PwBD-multiple disabilities (MD) category.In a Central Administrative Tribunal, Mumbai bench, order dated Feb 23, 2023, her name as the applicant was mentioned as Puja Manorama Dilip Khedkar. Probationary IAS officer Puja Khedkar had in August 2022 simultaneously applied for disability certificates for locomotor disability from District Civil Hospital, Aundh, and Yashwantrao Chavan Memorial Hospital, Pimpri, both in Pune, report Nisha Nambiar & Swati Shinde Gole.She did so despite having secured disability certificates for low vision in 2018 and for mental depression and low vision in 2021 from the Ahmednagar district hospital.The District Civil Hospital at Aundh had rejected her application because of "double submission", while Yashwantrao Chavan Memorial Hospital (YCMH), Pimpri, granted a 7% locomotor disability certificate citing an old ACL tear.In her defence amid the ongoing probe, Puja Khedkar on Monday said the "media trial" to prove her guilty was wrong."Everybody knows what is going on. So proving me guilty by media trial is wrong on everybody's part. The Indian Constitution is based on the fact that you are innocent till proven guilty" she said.
Article Summary: Puja Khedkar has been in the eye of the storm for alleged misuse of power and manipulating disability and OBC quotas. She allegedly submitted fake disability and Other Backward Class (OBC) certificates to clear the civil services exam. Reports indicate she also submitted a mental illness certificate.

Article Title: BRS leader K Kavitha taken to hospital from Tihar jail
Article Text: NEW DELHI: BRS MLC K Kavitha was admitted to Deendayal Upadhyay hospital on Tuesday after after she developed gynaecological problem and high fever in Tihar Jail."She was taken to DDU Hospital due to some health issues," an official said.The 46-year-old Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) leader was brought back to prison after undergoing some tests at the hospital, the officials added.After staying in the hospital for two hours, she was sent back to jail, the official said, adding that she is lodged in Tihar's jail number 6.The BRS leader was arrested on March 15 from Hyderabad , hours after an ED team searched the premises and interrogated her in a money laundering probe linked to the Delhi excise policy case. She is currently in judicial custody in Tihar Jail.Kavitha, daughter of former Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao was later arrested by the CBI on charges under sections of criminal conspiracy and falsification of accounts of the Indian Penal Code & certain sections of Prevention of Corruption Act.
Article Summary: BRS MLC K Kavitha was admitted to Deendayal Upadhyay hospital on Tuesday. She developed gynaecological problem and high fever in Tihar Jail. The 46-year-old Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) leader was brought back to prison after undergoing some tests at the hospital.

The Bharat Ratna award, India's highest civilian honour, was instituted in 1954 to recognize exceptional service across all fields of human endeavour, transcending distinctions of race, occupation, position, or gender. Bharat Ratna award celebrates the remarkable achievements of India's most distinguished individuals.The inaugural recipients included luminaries like Dr.Chandrasekhara Venkata Raman, C. Rajagopalachari, and Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, whose contributions have left an indelible mark on science, law, and education. Over the decades, the Bharat Ratna has continued to honour those who have significantly advanced the nation, reflecting India's diverse and rich legacy of excellence.Renowned for his pivotal role in India's Green Revolution, M. S. Swaminathan is a geneticist and agricultural scientist whose research and advocacy revolutionised Indian agriculture, ensuring food security and rural development.Deputy Prime Minister of India from 2002 to 2004, L. K. Advani played a significant role in Indian politics, particularly associated with the Ram Janmabhoomi movement, advocating for the construction of the Ram Temple in Ayodhya.As the 9th Prime Minister of India (1991-1996), P. V. Narasimha Rao initiated significant economic reforms and liberalisation policies that transformed India's economy, paving the way for its integration into the global economic landscape.Serving as the 5th Prime Minister of India (1979-1980), Charan Singh focused on agrarian reforms and improving farmers' rights, addressing crucial agricultural issues during his tenure.Known as the 11th Chief Minister of Bihar, Karpoori Thakur introduced the reservation policy for state government jobs in 1978, aimed at promoting social equity and opportunities for marginalised communities.Pranab Mukherjee served as the 13th President of India (2012-2017) and held various key ministerial portfolios during his political career. He was known for his deep understanding of parliamentary procedures and his contributions to economic policies.A prominent social activist, Nanaji Deshmukh focused on rural development, education, and health. He was associated with the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) and Bharatiya Jana Sangh, advocating for self-reliance and community welfare.Hailing from Assam, Bhupen Hazarika was a versatile artist known for his contributions to music, cinema, and social activism. He received the National Film Award for Best Music Direction and left a lasting legacy in Indian cultural spheres.Known for founding Banaras Hindu University (BHU), Madan Mohan Malaviya was a prominent figure in India's independence movement and a staunch advocate for education reform. He also served as the President of the Indian National Congress multiple times.A statesman and orator, Atal Bihari Vajpayee served as the Prime Minister of India three times. Known for his eloquence and inclusive leadership, he played a significant role in shaping India's political landscape and foreign policy.Known for his contributions in Solid State and Materials Chemistry, C. N. R. Rao has authored approximately 1,600 research papers and 48 books. His pioneering research has significantly advanced the field of chemistry, both in India and internationally.Regarded as one of the greatest cricketers of all time, Sachin Tendulkar holds numerous records in international cricket, including being the first player to score 100 international centuries. His achievements and impact on cricket have made him a sporting icon globally.Renowned for his mastery in the Khyal genre of singing, Bhimsen Joshi was one of the foremost vocalists in Hindustani classical music. His powerful voice and emotive renditions made him a legendary figure in Indian classical music.Known as the "Nightingale of India," Lata Mangeshkar has a career spanning over six decades, during which she became one of the most celebrated playback singers in Indian cinema. Her melodious voice and versatility have made her a cultural icon in India and beyond.Credited with popularising the shehnai, a traditional Indian wind instrument, Bismillah Khan's mastery and contributions to Hindustani classical music have earned him global recognition. His music enriched India's cultural heritage.Known for his leadership during the "Total Revolution Movement," Narayan mobilised public opinion against corruption and authoritarianism in Indian politics during the 1970s.Awarded the Nobel Prize in Economics in 1998 for his contributions to welfare economics and social choice theory. Sen's research has profoundly influenced global economic thought, focusing on poverty, social justice, and development.The first Chief Minister of Assam post-independence, Bordoloi played a crucial role in integrating Assam into the Indian Union amidst complex regional and political challenges.A legendary sitar virtuoso, Shankar popularised Indian classical music worldwide and collaborated extensively with Western musicians, bridging cultural divides through music.Renowned as the "Queen of Carnatic Music," Subbulakshmi was the first Indian musician to receive the Ramon Magsaysay Award. Her contributions to classical music earned her international acclaim.An independence activist and former Minister of Agriculture, Subramaniam played a crucial role in India's Green Revolution. His agricultural policies significantly boosted food production, ensuring food security for India's growing population.Known for her fearless activism during the Quit India Movement in 1942, where she bravely hoisted the Indian flag in Bombay despite the risk of British reprisal. Post-independence, she became Delhi's first mayor in 1958, marking a transition from revolutionary activism to leadership in local governance.A pioneering aerospace and defence scientist, Kalam played a pivotal role in India's missile development programs, including the successful SLV III and the Integrated Guided Missile Development Program (IGMDP). Elected as the 11th President of India in 2002, Kalam's presidency was marked by his vision for a developed India, focusing on education, technology, and youth empowerment.An independence activist who served as interim Prime Minister of India twice, first in 1964 and again in 1966, following the deaths of Jawaharlal Nehru and Lal Bahadur Shastri respectively. Nanda provided stability during transitional periods in Indian politics. He also served as the Deputy Chairman of the Planning Commission, where he contributed to economic planning and development strategies crucial for India's early post-independence growth.Abul Kalam Azad, known as "Maulana Azad," was an independence activist and India's first Minister of Education. He advocated for free primary education and his birthday, November 11, is observed as National Education Day in India.J. R. D. Tata, an industrialist and philanthropist, founded India's first airline, Air India. He established various institutes, including Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Tata Memorial Hospital, Tata Institute of Social Sciences, Tata Motors, and TCS.Satyajit Ray, a filmmaker, gained world recognition with his debut film "Pather Panchali" (1955). His work significantly influenced Indian and international cinema.Rajiv Gandhi served as the ninth Prime Minister of India from 1984 to 1989. He is known for his efforts to modernise India and his contributions to the technology and telecommunications sectors.Vallabhbhai Patel, widely known as the "Iron Man of India," was an independence activist and the first Deputy Prime Minister of India (1947–50). He played a crucial role in the integration of princely states into the Indian union post-independence.Morarji Desai was an independence activist who served as the sixth Prime Minister of India (1977–79). He is the only Indian national to be awarded the Nishan-e-Pakistan, the highest civilian award given by the Government of Pakistan.B. R. Ambedkar, a social reformer and leader of the Dalits ("Untouchables"), was the chief architect of the Indian Constitution and served as the first Law Minister of India. He campaigned against social discrimination and led the Dalit Buddhist movement, converting to Buddhism along with half a million followers in 1956.Nelson Mandela was a leader of the Anti-Apartheid Movement in South Africa and served as the President of South Africa (1994–99). Often called the "Gandhi of South Africa," Mandela’s movement was influenced by Gandhian philosophy. He was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 1993.M. G. Ramachandran, an actor turned politician, served as the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu for three terms (1977–80, 1980–84, and 1985–87). He was a popular and influential leader known for his work in Tamil Nadu's development.Khan Abdul Ghaffar Khan, widely known as "Frontier Gandhi," was a Pashtun leader and independence activist who founded the Khudai Khidmatgar ("Red Shirt movement") in 1929. He was a follower of Mahatma Gandhi and joined the Khilafat Movement in 1920.Vinoba Bhave, a close associate of Mahatma Gandhi, was an independence activist and social reformer best known for his Bhoodan movement ("Land-Gift Movement"). He was awarded the Ramon Magsaysay Award in 1958 for his humanitarian work.K. Kamaraj, an independence activist and statesman, served as the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu for three terms (1954–57, 1957–62, and 1962–63). He played a pivotal role in Tamil Nadu's educational and industrial development.V. V. Giri was an Indian labour leader and independence activist who served as the first President of the All India Trade Union Congress in 1926. Post-independence, he held various positions, including Governor of Uttar Pradesh, Kerala, and Mysore, and was elected as the fourth President of India (1969–74).Indira Gandhi, often referred to as the "Iron Lady of India," served as Prime Minister during two terms (1966–77 and 1980–84). Her leadership during the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971 led to the formation of Bangladesh.Lal Bahadur Shastri, known for his slogan "Jai Jawan Jai Kisan" ("Hail the Soldier, Hail the Farmer"), served as the second Prime Minister of India (1964–66) and led the nation during the Indo-Pakistani War of 1965.Zakir Husain, an independence activist, economist, and education philosopher, served as Vice-Chancellor of Aligarh Muslim University (1948–56) and Governor of Bihar (1957–62). He was the second Vice-President of India (1962–67) and later the third President of India (1967–69).Pandurang Vaman Kane was a renowned Indologist and Sanskrit scholar best known for his five-volume work, "History of Dharmasastra: Ancient and Mediaeval Religious and Civil Law in India," which spans nearly 6,500 pages and was published from 1930 to 1962.Rajendra Prasad was an independence activist, lawyer, statesman, and scholar. Closely associated with Mahatma Gandhi in the non-cooperation movement, he was elected as the first President of India (1950–62).Bidhan Chandra Roy was a prominent physician, political leader, philanthropist, and social worker, often referred to as the "Maker of Modern West Bengal." He served as the second Chief Minister of West Bengal (1948–62), and his birthday, July 1, is celebrated as National Doctors' Day in India.Known as "Rajarshi," Purushottam Das Tandon was an independence activist who served as the speaker of the United Provinces Legislative Assembly(1937–50). He played a significant role in advocating for Hindi as an official language of India.Social reformer and educator Dhondo Keshav Karve is renowned for his work in promoting women’s education and the remarriage of Hindu widows. He established several institutions, including the Widow Marriage Association (1883), Hindu Widows Home (1896), and Shreemati Nathibai Damodar Thackersey Women's University (1916).Govind Ballabh Pant was a key independence activist and the first Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh (1950–54). He served as the Union Home Minister from 1955 to 1961, playing a crucial role in India's political and social reforms.Bhagwan Das was an Indian independence activist, philosopher, and educationist. He co-founded the Mahatma Gandhi Kashi Vidyapith and collaborated with Madan Mohan Malaviya in establishing Banaras Hindu University, contributing significantly to Indian education and independence movements.M. Visvesvaraya was a distinguished civil engineer and statesman, serving as the Diwan of Mysore from 1912 to 1918. Known for his contributions to engineering and public works, his birthday on September 15 is celebrated as "Engineer's Day" in India. He was also honoured with the title Knight Commander of the Order of the Indian Empire (KCIE).Jawaharlal Nehru, a leading figure in the Indian independence movement and an eminent author, became the first and longest-serving Prime Minister of India (1947–64). His vision and policies laid the foundation for modern India.C. Rajagopalachari, popularly known as Rajaji, was a prominent Indian independence activist, statesman, and lawyer. He was the last Governor-General of independent India and the only Indian to hold that position. Rajaji was also the Chief Minister of Madras Presidency (1937–39) and Madras State (1952–54). He founded the Indian political party, the Swatantra Party, which advocated for a market-based economy and minimal government intervention in personal liberties.Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan served as India’s first Vice President (1952–62) and the second President (1962–67). An esteemed philosopher and statesman, Radhakrishnan’s birthday, September 5, has been celebrated as "Teachers' Day" in India since 1962, honouring his belief in the importance of education and educators.Renowned physicist C. V. Raman is celebrated for his groundbreaking work on the scattering of light, known as "Raman scattering." This discovery earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1930. His contributions to atomic physics and electromagnetism have been fundamental in the field of science.In a single year, up to three individuals can receive the prestigious Bharat Ratna award. However, in 2024, this honour was bestowed upon five distinguished personalities: Karpoori Thakur, L. K. Advani, P. V. Narasimha Rao, Charan Singh, and M. S. Swaminathan.It's important to note that formal recommendations for the Bharat Ratna are not required. The Prime Minister of India recommends deserving candidates directly to the President of India for consideration. Notably, no Bharat Ratna awards were conferred from 2020 to 2023.
Article Summary: Bharat Ratna award winners: List of recipients from 1954 - 2024. List of winners from 1954 to 2024. Bharat Ratnas awarded for excellence in public service or public service in India. Winners were awarded for services to India, politics, science and culture.

Article Title: An ‘accident-in-waiting’: Kanchanjunga Express report cites multiple-level lapses
Article Text: NEW DELHI/KOLKATA: Commission of Railway Safety (CRS), in its provisional findings in the Kanchanjunga Express accident that claimed 10 lives, has pointed to wrong authority letters issued to loco pilots on how to negotiate defective signals and lapses at “multiple levels” in train operations following failure of automatic signals.In its report to the Railway Board, CRS grimly noted that this was an “accident-in-waiting”, citing how improper authority letters were issued at the zonal level to loco pilots and that too without adequate information.The report, although provisional, has virtually exonerated the goods train loco pilot Amit Kumar, who was faulted by railway authorities in the immediate wake of the mishap while pointing a finger at ambiguity in rules to be followed in cases of failure of automatic signals, the Rangapani station master and senior authorities in Katihar division.The loco pilot was among those killed in the accident on June 17 in West Bengal's Darjeeling district.The CRS said the ‘paper authority’ issued to loco pilots of trains operating between Rangapani and Chatterhat on that day when automatic signals had failed did not mention the speed limit that drivers were supposed to follow while crossing defective signals. Also, the loco pilot and the train manager were not provided with walkie-talkies which could have ensured better communication.On the role of the loco pilot of the goods train that collided with Kanchanjungha Express, the report said the authority letter (T/A 912) was given to him to pass all the mentioned defective signals without any caution order. “This created an impression in the mind of the loco pilot that all defective signals can be passed at the maximum permissible speed of the section,” it said.The maximum speed of the section was 110 kmph. The goods train was moving at 78 kmph and when the loco pilot applied brakes, he couldn’t decelerate below 40 kmph and ended up rear-ending Kanchanjunga Express, which had stopped.Immediately after the mishap, Railway Board chairperson Jaya Verma Sinha had claimed that Kumar had disregarded signals and this led to the accident.The report pointed out that on the day of the accident, officials should have treated the signalling failure — reported at 5.50am — as a “major signal failure” and followed the ‘automatic block system (ABS)’. In this system, only one train is allowed to stay between two stations. No other train is supposed to enter the stretch until the preceding one has reached the next station.In this case, not declaring ABS meant the station master at Rangapani allowed the goods train to enter the section without confirming with the Chatterhat station master whether Kanchanjungha Express had crossed. The Rangapani station master also issued the wrong authority letter (T/A 912, which does not have any speed restrictions, instead of T/B 912, which limits speed to 25kmph) to loco pilots of the two trains involved in the accident, as well as five other trains preceding them.The railway safety regulator found that besides these two trains, five other trains had entered the section since the signals turned defective on that day, each following different speeds while passing defective signals.“It is evident that the understanding of loco pilots regarding action to be taken when T/A 912 is issued is not clear to them. Some loco pilots have followed the 15kmph rule while most loco pilots did not follow this rule. The absence of proper authority and that too without adequate information created misinterpretation and misunderstanding about the speed to be followed,” the report said.It also mentioned that no caution order was issued to the loco pilots by the station master.As per the findings, only Kanchanjungha Express followed the norm of moving at a maximum speed of 15kmph and stopping for one minute at each defective signal while the remaining six trains, including the goods train, didn’t follow this norm.The report also flagged that there was “inadequate counselling of loco pilots and station masters” about train operation in automatic signalling territory. It said “ad hocism” was prevalent at the divisional level in issuing the authorities and instructions, and station masters were adopting different procedures.The CRS said in case of multiple signal failures , there were three options left with the rail administration, but they followed none.On the role of others, the report said the control office at the divisional level must be manned by one senior section engineer, one junior engineer and one helper round-the-clock in an eight-hour shift. However, on the night of June 16, the signalling control office was manned by a technician.“It is not possible to manage such a major signalling failure by a staff of technician level. The response of higher officials of the signalling department at the divisional level posted in Katihar has been found lacklustre as despite being informed about this serious failure, none of them went to the control office to manage and coordinate with other departments for timely attention of signalling failures,” it said.
Article Summary: Commission of Railway Safety (CRS) has pointed to wrong authority letters issued to loco pilots on how to negotiate defective signals. CRS grimly noted that this was an ‘accident-in-waiting’ The report, although provisional, has virtually exonerated the goods train loco pilot Amit Kumar.

Article Title: Automatic Signalling System: Railways Report: Improve Reliability of Automatic Signalling System
Article Text:
We also published the following articles recently

Railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw slams Congress over loco pilot work allegations

Railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw addresses concerns raised by Congress regarding loco pilots' work conditions, highlighting improvements in facilities. Learn more about the detailed response and monitoring of duty hours for train drivers.

'Fake news will fail': Railway minister Vaishnaw counters Rahul Gandhi's claims on 'poor' condition of loco pilots

Learn about Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw's response to Rahul Gandhi's meeting with loco pilots, highlighting improvements in working conditions and recruitment efforts in the railway sector.

NEW DELHI: Raising concern over a large number of signalling failures in “automatic signalling” sections, the Commission of Railway Safety (CRS) has recommended the national transporter to “improve reliability” of the system. Railway Board officials said on Tuesday that a comprehensive action plan is being developed to enhance the reliability and resilience of signalling equipment across the country.The CRS, in its report on the Kanchanjungha Express accident, said that there were 275 failures in the automatic signalling section of just Katihar Division since its commissioning in Jan 2023 to June 20, 2024. It said a large number of signaling failures in the automatic signalling section “is defeating the very purpose of mobility enhancement and causing safety concerns”.Referring to the 208 instances of signal passing at danger (SPAD) between April 2019 and March 2024, out of which 12 cases resulted in collision, the safety regulator said this highlights limitations of preventive measures taken by Zonal Railways (counselling of loco pilot, assistant loco pilots and drives). It has recommended expediting the roll out of anti-train collision system, Kavach.Meanwhile, the Railway Board has instructed all zones to standardise training programmes for loco pilots operating in automatic signalling areas. It has specified one-day intensive counselling sessions based on an automatic signalling system for loco pilots and their assistants every six months.It said the counselling focus should be on working procedures, especially in automatic signalling territories and relevant forms should be issued for abnormal operations with speed restrictions. The loco pilots will be shown animated videos which highlight common crew mistakes.
Article Summary: Railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw addresses concerns raised by Congress regarding loco pilots' work conditions. The Commission of Railway Safety (CRS) has recommended the national transporter to ‘improve reliability’ of the system. The Railway Board has instructed all zones to standardise training programmes for loco pilot operating in automatic signalling areas.

Article Title: Railway Board: Railway Board forms panel to address grievances of drivers and guards
Article Text:
We also published the following articles recently

Railway minister Ashwini Vaishnaw slams Congress over loco pilot work allegations

Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw defends loco pilots' work conditions against Congress criticism, emphasizing improved cabs and resting facilities. Loco pilots' duty hours are monitored and average below 8 hours per trip. Association calls for better rest periods to be addressed.

Loco drivers spared, 3 others suspended for West Bengal train crash

Northeast Frontier Railway takes action after Bengal train accident, suspending station superintendent, signal technician, and guard. Kanchanjungha Express driver not penalized. Investigation ongoing.

NEW DELHI: The Railway Board has constituted a multi-disciplinary committee to look into the grievances of the loco pilots and train managers (guards) raised by their unions. The panel will submit a report within a month. This comes after recent train accidents and opposition MPs, including Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, rasing the issues of loco pilots and other loco running staff.As per the notification, the multi-disciplinary panel will deliberate, engage with federations and submit a holistic recommendation on the issues and grievances of loco running staff raised by recognised and un-recognised unions.It consists of five executive directors (EDs) from different departments of the Railway Board and one ED (traffic) from the RDSO (Research Designs and Standards Organisation).The committee will review issues such as legislation on break for a meal and attending nature's call, duty hours, periodic tests and deployment of manpower and their utilisation, change of definition of high-speed trains to 130 kmph from the existing 110 kmph and deployment of assistant loco pilots in trains up to (including) the speed of 130 kmph.So far as the aptitude test of loco pilots and assistant loco pilots is concerned, the Railway Board has said that the panel will also look into the issues of whether “to make qualifying the aptitude test mandatory at the stage of promotion itself”. The Board wants the panel to decide regarding the redeployment of drivers who have failed the aptitude test after SPAD (jumping of red signal).
Article Summary: The Railway Board has constituted a multi-disciplinary committee to look into the grievances of the loco pilots. The panel will submit a report within a month. This comes after recent train accidents and opposition MPs, including Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, rasing the issues of loco running staff.

Article Title: Bigamy serious offence, says SC, punishes couple
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Observing that bigamy is a serious offence for which undue leniency could not be shown towards an accused, Supreme Court has awarded six-month jail term to a woman and her second husband who got married during subsistence of her first marriage and set aside Madras HC which had let them off with 'imprisonment till rising of the court'.The bench said court must not only keep in view rights of the accused but also the society at large while considering imposition of appropriate punishment.It said a meagre sentence imposed without considering degree of offence will be counterproductive.
Article Summary: Supreme Court has awarded six-month jail term to a woman and her second husband who got married during subsistence of her first marriage. Madras HC had let them off with 'imprisonment till rising of the court' The bench said court must not only keep in view rights of the accused but also the society at large while considering appropriate punishment.

Article Title: Supreme Court seeks to bring order into West Bengal jobs case chaos
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Supreme Court on Tuesday found itself engulfed in a chaotic environ as a medley of senior advocates and lawyers appearing for various parties attempted to speak in one voice as soon as it took up a petition filed by West Bengal govt challenging a Calcutta HC order cancelling appointment of 25,000 teachers and other staff."There has to be some order in this chaos," said a bench of CJI D Y Chandrachud & Justices J B Pardiwala & Manoj Misra before it divided the parties into 5 categories - West Bengal, WB Central School Services Commission, petitioners before HC leading to cancellation of appointments, persons whose appointments were cancelled by HC, & CBI .The same bench had on May 7 stayed the Calcutta HC order but allowed CBI to continue with its probes into the alleged scam without arresting the tainted candidates or taking coercive action against officials involved.The bench appointed four nodal counsel - Astha Sharma, Kunal Chatterjee, Shekhar Kumar & Shalini Kaul, & asked lawyers representing parties from the categories to submit written submissions raising core issues to nodal counsel to enable them prepare common compilation to facilitate easy reference to material during hearing.Court allowed the writ petitioners to file affidavits responding to WB's appeal in 2 weeks, failing which no further chance will be given.
Article Summary: West Bengal govt challenging a Calcutta HC order cancelling appointment of 25,000 teachers and other staff. The bench appointed four nodal counsel - Astha Sharma, Kunal Chatterjee, Shekhar Kumar & Shalini Kaul. Court allowed the writ petitioners to file affidavits responding to WB's appeal in 2 weeks.

Article Title: HC: Didn't get SC collegium note on judge picks even after 6 months
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Himachal HC in Shimla is just 340km from SC but sensitive apex court communications did not reach it for six months and HC chief justice, without consulting the collegium, wrote to SC about non-suitability of two senior-most judicial officers, earlier recommended for appointment as HC judges.This was stated in HC registrar general J K Sharma's report on Monday before a bench of Justices Hrishikesh Roy and SVN Bhatti, which is hearing a petition filed by judicial officers Chirag Bhanu Singh and Arvind Malhotra alleging that HC collegium brushed aside SC collegium 's Jan 4 directive to reconsider an earlier proposal to appoint them as HC judges and recommended judicial officers junior to them for elevation.In the report, HC said its CJ had written to CJI D Y Chandrachud on Dec 11 last year "seeking guidance on whether SC collegium requires any further inputs about suitability of Singh and Malhotra".However, the law minister on Jan 16 wrote to HC CJ pointing to the Jan 4 SC collegium resolution sending back names of Singh and Malhotra to HC for reconsideration.HC told SC it had not received SC collegium's Jan 4 resolution even after 6 months. It said law minister's letter, extracting SC collegium's resolution, appeared to convey that it was for HC CJ alone to reconsider proposal for elevation.This turns upside down the basics of collegium-based judge selection system, created through two judgments of SC in the 1990s and specifying that HC collegium means the CJ and two senior-most judges, and for SC, it is the CJI with four senior-most judges.Continuing to doubt if SC collegium had sent back names of Singh and Malhotra for reconsideration, HC said CJI on Feb 27 wrote to HC CJ reminding him about filling vacancies of judges' posts in HC.
Article Summary: Himachal HC in Shimla is just 340km from SC but sensitive communications did not reach it for six months. HC chief justice, without consulting the collegium, wrote to SC about non-suitability of two senior-most judicial officers.

Article Title: Slammed by SC, retired judge quits probe panel against KCR
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Critiqued by Supreme Court on Tuesday for breaching fairness norms, Justice L Narasimha Reddy declined to continue as the one-man commission to inquire into alleged power sector irregularities caused by K Chandrashekar Rao-led BRS government. Telangana government said it will notify a new chairperson by Monday, reports .A bench of Chief Justice D Y Chandrachud and Justices J B Pardiwala and Manoj Misra agreed with KCR 's counsel, senior advocate Mukul Rohatgi, that Justice Reddy gave away his predisposed mind by commenting in a June 16 press conference about loss caused to the exchequer, an issue he was to inquire into."What crime has KCR committed to face such political vendetta? The whole commission of inquiry reeks of political vendetta. What fairness does he expect from the inquiry commission when the retired judge has already made up his mind and made comments about findings even before KCR has put in his reply," Rohatgi asked.Senior advocate A M Singhvi, who defended the appointment of the CoI by the Revanth Reddy govt, strongly rebutted Rohatgi's submissions and said the CoI's findings would be recommendatory in nature and the entire gamut of civil and criminal law remedies will be open for the ex-CM to challenge the findings. "At worst, Justice Reddy could be said to have been quirky but that does not mean the CoI, appointed to look into documents reflecting glaring irregularities, should be derailed," he said.Appearing for Justice Reddy, senior advocate Gopal Sankaranarayanan informed the court that the retired judge has sent a communication expressing his desire to recuse from the CoI.
Article Summary: Justice L Narasimha Reddy declined to continue as the one-man commission to inquire into alleged power sector irregularities caused by K Chandrashekar Rao- led BRS government. Telangana government said it will notify a new chairperson by Monday.

Article Title: With 1st judge from Manipur, SC back at full strength of 34
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Three working days after the Supreme Court collegium recommended two judges to be appointed to the top court, law ministry on Tuesday notified the elevation of Justice R Mahadevan , a judge of Madras high court, and Justice N Kotiswar Singh , chief justice of J&K and Ladakh HC, as judges of the apex court.In two other appointments, Justice D Krishnakumar, a judge of Madras HC, was appointed acting chief justice of HC, and Justice Tashi Rabstan, a judge of J&K and Ladakh HC, as its acting CJ.With these two elevations to SC, the top court will have its full strength of 34 judges, including Chief Justice of India.The SC collegium had recommended elevation of Justice Singh to SC on July 11. He will be the first judge from Manipur to be appointed to the apex court.While recommending Justice Singh, the SC collegium had said, "His appointment as a judge of Supreme Court will provide representation to the north-east, and in particular he will be the first judge from Manipur to be appointed as a judge of SC." Justice Singh hails from Manipur and was appointed as a judge of Gauhati HC on Oct 17, 2011. On formation of Manipur HC, he was transferred as a judge there. On Feb 15, 2023, he was appointed CJ of J&K and Ladakh HC. He is due to retire on Feb 28, 2025.On the recommendation of Justice Mahadevan, the SC collegium said, "He belongs to a backward community from Tamil Nadu and his appointment will bring diversity to the bench. "
Article Summary: Justice R Mahadevan, a judge of Madras high court, and Justice N Kotiswar Singh, chief justice of J&K and Ladakh HC, appointed as judges of the apex court. In two other appointments, Justice D Krishnakumar was appointed acting Chief Justice of HC and Justice Tashi Rabstan as acting CJ.

Article Title: Consumer watchdog slaps Rs 10 lakh fine on firm selling ayurvedic oil through ‘misleading’ advertisements
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Continuing its crackdown on misleading advertisements, Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed Rs 10 lakh fine on a company selling an ayurvedic product claiming it as “magic oil” which when applied makes one “fit even without any surgery or physiotherapy.”The CCPA headed by Union consumer affairs secretary Nidhi Khare has ordered discontinuation of the misleading advertisement related to the product “Dhuandhar Oil” manufactured by Indiyaa Distribution Network LLP .Officials said that during the process of investigation and hearing, the company could not substantiate any of the claims.“The decision to impose fine and immediate discontinuation of advertisement was taken to protect and promote the rights of consumers as a class and ensure that no false or misleading advertisement is made for any goods or services, which contravenes the provisions of the Consumer Protection Act,” said an official.The advertisement of the product was being telecast on the Arogya Rahesya Programme and on company’s website related to the product wherein they made several claims, which included describing the product as the “world’s 1st hotstream joint pain relieving oil” and “mere application of the oil gives patients quick relief from joint pain, stiffness, and inflammation,” and that the oil ensures fitness without surgery or physiotherapy.It also claimed that the product is manufactured as per government rules and regulations and that regular application provides permanent relief from pain. The company also claimed that it has no side effects and no parallel product worldwide. “The advertisement mentioned a money-back guarantee and a person purported to be a doctor, wearing a white coat, also recommended the use of this oil to his patients for pain relief,” said the official.Before passing the order, CCPA sent the matter to director general of investigation which observed that in the absence of any supporting documents, research papers or scientific studies, the claim of the company appeared to be grossly exaggerated and misleading. “The company in its reply to CCPA submitted that players also use this product to keep themselves fit. However, during the investigation the company did not submit any evidence for its claims,” a source said.
Article Summary: Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed Rs 10 lakh fine on a company selling an ayurvedic product claiming it as “magic oil” The CCPA headed by Union consumer affairs secretary Nidhi Khare has ordered discontinuation of the misleading advertisement related to the product “Dhuandhar Oil”

Article Title: Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu meets Amit Shah, seeks higher allocation for state in Union Budget
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu met Union home minister Amit Shah here late Tuesday night, urging for a substantial fund allocation in the upcoming Union Budget to address the state's financial challenges , sources said. During the meeting at Shah's residence, the Telugu Desam Party (TDP) president emphasised that Andhra Pradesh continues to face the aftermath of the "unjust bifurcation" in 2014 and the previous administration's "miserable governance," according to sources.Naidu, who arrived in the national capital on Tuesday evening for a two-day visit, is expected to meet Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Wednesday to further discuss the state's financial needs. A meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi is also likely on the cards, the sources added.The Andhra Pradesh government data reveals a worrying trend in the state's fiscal health. The public debt has risen from 31.02 per cent of the Gross State Domestic Product (GSDP) in 2019-20 to 33.32 per cent in 2023-24, indicating a deterioration over the past five years.This is Naidu's second trip to Delhi in nearly a fortnight. On July 4, he presented a seven-point development agenda to the Prime Minister, aimed at addressing the state's post-bifurcation challenges.Naidu's advocacy for increased funding comes on the heels of a similar move by JD(U) national working president Sanjay Kumar Jha, who met Sitharaman on Monday seeking higher allocations for Bihar in the upcoming Budget.Both TDP and JD(U) are key constituents of the BJP-led NDA. TDP is leveraging its coalition partnership to push for Andhra Pradesh's financial needs ahead of Union Budget 2024.During his previous Delhi visit, Naidu had also held talks with Shah and other Union ministers, including Sitharaman, underscoring the urgency of the state's financial requirements.
Article Summary: Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu met Union home minister Amit Shah here late Tuesday night. He urged for a substantial fund allocation in the upcoming Union Budget to address the state's financial challenges. TDP president emphasised that Andhra Pradesh continues to face the aftermath of the "unjust bifurcation" in 2014.

Article Title: Chandragiri MLA vows to establish a modern crematorium at constituency headquarters soon
Article Text: TIRUPATI: "Govinda Dhamam", a modern gas-fired cremation ground , is all set to come up in the constituency headquarters town of Chandragiri soon.TDP MLA Pulivarthi Venkata Mani Prasad (Nani) has announced to focus on sanitation in the constituency by taking up sewer lines in the rural areas with the coordinated efforts of Panchayat Raj and revenue departments.Nani toured the town along with party leaders and officials on Tuesday, when he underlined the need for a proper cremation ground to dispose of dead bodies in a respectful manner. Akin to the ‘Govinda Dhamam’ in Tirupati, Nani proposed to develop a similar facility on the banks of River Swarnamukhi near Narasingapuram village, abutting the Chandragiri - Srinivasa Mangapuram road.The MLA recalled his recent visit to the house of his deceased party workers and recalled the ordeals faced by the bereaved family to give a decent farewell to the departed souls.The facility would also come with a beautiful garden and a hall to conduct memorial meetings. He also instructed the officials to explore the possibility of identifying a five-acre site to set up APPTD (earlier APSRTC) depot in Chandragiri.Taking a snipe at the erstwhile YSR Congress government, particularly his predecessor Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy, for neglecting rural sanitation, Nani recalled that a lion’s share of the representations received by him in the last one month of alliance government pertained to sanitation, including overflowing drains and slushy roads.Ahead of the ensuing Adi Krithika festival, the MLA visited Anandagiri Sri Subramanya Swamy temple in Ootlavaripalle of Pakala mandal, where he directed the officials to provide drinking water facility and take up sanitation around the shrine.
Article Summary: TDP MLA Pulivarthi Venkata Mani Prasad (Nani) has announced to focus on sanitation in the constituency by taking up sewer lines in the rural areas. Akin to the ‘Govinda Dhamam’ in Tirupati, Nani proposed to develop a similar facility on the banks of River Swarnamukhi near Narasingapuram village.

Article Title: Prime Minister Modi to release 100 new seed varieties in Sept, Chouhan pitches for model farm for small and marginal farmers
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Prime Minister Narendra Modi may release 100 new seed varieties of different crops and 100 farm technologies on completion of the first 100 days of his third term in September.Broader plan of this move under the 100 days' agenda of Modi 3.0 was discussed during the 96th foundation day celebration of the Indian Council of Agricultural Research ( ICAR ) in the past two days where farm scientists brainstormed how the benefits of innovation quickly reach the farmers through 'lab to land' approach.New varieties of seed which are being developed include high-yielding, short duration and climate-resilient seeds for dealing with various biotic and non-biotic stresses such as drought and flood. Newly developed farm technologies are meant for water management and precision agriculture that can reduce input costs of farmers so that their income can be multiplied.Addressing the foundation day function here on Tuesday, agriculture and rural development minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan appealed to ICAR to come out with a model farm showing how small and marginal land-holding farmers can be benefited from it through integrated farming, crop diversification and judicious use of resources.He emphasised that the priority of the government is not only to increase production and productivity, and reduce dependence on imports of crops such as pulses and oilseeds but also to address the concerns of small and marginal land-holding farmers who account for the majority (nearly 85%) of total farmers in the country."Our farmers have very small sizes of land up to 1acre, 1.5 acre or 2 acres. We have to think about them and see how they can be benefited from practical utilization of research and innovation," said Chouhan.Underlining the need to reach the benefits of research to farmers through sincerely adopting 'lab to land' approach, the minister suggested the ICAR to send a batch of two scientists each to all 731 'Krishi Vigyan Kendra' (farm extension centres) across the country to study the problems of farmers and provide solutions to end their woes.Chouhan also asked the scientists to set a target of four years and work to achieve it so that they can show results on the ground when they assemble on the occasion of the 100th foundation day of the ICAR in 2028.He said, " Prime Minister Modi has resolved to make India developed by 2047, in which agriculture and allied sectors (livestock, dairy and fisheries) will play an important role."Chouhan, former chief minister of Madhya Pradesh, also cited example of his home state, saying it was once considered 'BIMARU' state (acronym coined for states like Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh due to their low economic growth) but agricultural development has taken it out from that group.
Article Summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi may release 100 new seed varieties of different crops and 100 farm technologies on completion of the first 100 days of his third term in September. Newly developed farm technologies are meant for water management and precision agriculture that can reduce input costs of farmers so that their income can be multiplied.

Article Title: Surge in pharma & healthcare deals in Q2
Article Text: The pharma and healthcare sector witnessed significant deal flow in Q2 2024 with 55 deals totaling $4.1 billion, marking an 8x increase in values and a 10% rise in volumes over the previous quarter. The average deal size surged from $9.7 million in Q1 2024 to $74 million this quarter, driven by 11 high-value deals worth $3.4 billion, compared to just one high-value deal worth $150 million in Q1 2024, the Pharma Dealtracker report by Grant Thornton Bharat said.Deal values increased by 57% year- on- year, despite a notable $2 billion deal in the previous year executed by Temasek Holdings to acquire a 41% stake in Manipal Health Enterprises. Volumes witnessed a similar trend with 49% growth, reaching 55 deals this quarter, up from 37 deals in Q2 2023.M&As witnessed a huge rise with 3.8x increase in values, reaching $1.4 billion, with volumes increasing by 29% from 14 deals in Q1 2024 to 18 deals this quarter.The top M&A deal was Dr Reddy’s Laboratories' acquisition of a 100% stake in Northstar Switzerland SARL for $633 million, which accounted for 46% of the quarter’s overall M&A values. This significant deal underscores the growing momentum and high-value nature of M&A activity in the sector, insights from Grant Thorton said.Domestic consolidations continued to lead in terms of deal volumes, while outbound deals dominated in terms of values, contributing 74% to the M&A space in Q2 2024 in contrast to previous quarters. This quarter also recorded the second-highest quarterly outbound volumes and values compared to the past five years, indicating strong interest in cross-border investments despite global economic uncertainties.Further, PE activity witnessed a similar trend with a 21x increase in values, while volumes remained steady, driven by an increase in large transactions and improved investor confidence.The healthtech and medical devices segments are experiencing growing investor interest, with three deals in healthtech and two deals in medical devices valuing over $100 million. The largest PE deal was KKR Asian Fund IV's investment in Healthium MedTech, estimated at $843 million, accounting for 31% of the PE value this quarter.
Article Summary: The pharma and healthcare sector witnessed significant deal flow in Q2 2024 with 55 deals totaling $4.1 billion, marking an 8x increase in values and a 10% rise in volumes over the previous quarter. The average deal size surged from $9.7 million in Q1 2024 to $74 million this quarter, driven by 11 high-value deals.

Article Title: 'Proving me guilty by media trial is wrong': Probationary IAS Puja Khedkar reacts to allegations
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Probationary IAS officer Puja Khedkar, in the eye of a storm over the authenticity of her disability and OBC status claims that got her appointed to the civil services, on Monday said the media trial against her is unfair and she will address all the allegations against her before the committee."Everybody knows what is going on. So proving me guilty by media trial is wrong on everybody's part.The Indian Constitution is based on the fact that you are innocent till proven guilty" She said."I will testify in front of the expert committee and we will accept the decision of the committee...I do not have the right to tell you whatever investigation is going on. Whatever submission I have, will become public later." Khedkar added.In a related development, it has come to light that Khedkar reportedly submitted a fitness certificate upon admission to a private medical college in 2007 that did not mention any physical or mental disability, according to the institute's director, Dr. Arvind Bhore. She also provided documents indicating her classification under the NT (Nomadic Tribes) category and Vanjari community, including caste and non-creamy layer certificates.The central government established a single-member committee to examine the claims and details surrounding Khedkar's candidature. The ministry of personnel announced that the committee, chaired by a senior officer of the rank of Additional Secretary, would submit its report in two weeks.The IAS trainee was also accused of removing the nameplate of a senior official at the Pune collector's office when he allowed her to use his ante-chamber as her office.More seriously, Khedkar allegedly submitted fake disability and Other Backward Class (OBC) certificates to clear the civil services exam. Reports indicate she also submitted a mental illness certificate. In April 2022, she was asked to report to the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Delhi, for verification of her disability certificate but did not comply, citing a Covid-19 infection.
Article Summary: Puja Khedkar says the media trial against her is unfair and she will address all the allegations against her before the committee. The IAS trainee was also accused of removing the nameplate of a senior official at the Pune collector's office when he allowed her to use his ante-chamber as her office.
